intro: Wrapping a present is a kind gesture that can show someone how much you care, and it can make the present feel more special to your loved one. It's easy to wrap a present if you make all your folds and cuts carefully. When you're done with the basic wrapping, you can give the present a unique touch with bows and embellishments. When finished, you'll have a beautiful gift to present to a loved one.

steps.title: Twist both ends to enclose the cylinder.
steps.subtitle: The paper on the flat side of the cylinder should still be sticking out. Starting on one end, pinch the paper at the base of the object and twist it around two or three times. Then, wrap a piece of tape around the twist to secure it. Repeat on the other side.
sub-points: The wrapping job should resemble the wrapping of a piece of candy, like a Tootsie Roll.
